update.description: Currently when entities are removed from the world they are not removed from the scene manager in the Sensor system. This causes an inconsistency between the what's shown by the gui and the camera sensor. This pull request provides a fix. It also adds a test to make sure recreating the entities after removing them does not crash ogre as it has in the past.
update.title: [A-1] Support for removing entities in the Sensor system

pullrequest.title: [A-1] Support for removing entities in the Sensor system

content.raw:
This fixes compilation for me, but the tests are not generated :cry: I'm using Nvidia docker...

~~~
diff -r 37f3fbf6699e test/CMakeLists.txt
--- a/test/CMakeLists.txt       Fri Feb 08 14:50:26 2019 -0800
+++ b/test/CMakeLists.txt       Fri Feb 08 15:08:12 2019 -0800
@@ -78,7 +78,7 @@
       if(NOT GL_FAIL_RESULT)
         message(STATUS " + found a valid dri display (pyopengl)")
         set(VALID_DRI_DISPLAY TRUE)
-      else()
+      elseif(${GL_ERROR})
         # Check error string: no python module means no pyopengl
         string(
           FIND ${GL_ERROR} "ImportError: No module named OpenGL.GLUT" ERROR_POS
~~~
content.html:
This fixes compilation for me, but the tests are not generated I'm using Nvidia docker...

diff -r 37f3fbf6699e test/CMakeLists.txt
--- a/test/CMakeLists.txt       Fri Feb 08 14:50:26 2019 -0800
+++ b/test/CMakeLists.txt       Fri Feb 08 15:08:12 2019 -0800
@@ -78,7 +78,7 @@
       if(NOT GL_FAIL_RESULT)
         message(STATUS " + found a valid dri display (pyopengl)")
         set(VALID_DRI_DISPLAY TRUE)
-      else()
+      elseif(${GL_ERROR})
         # Check error string: no python module means no pyopengl
         string(
           FIND ${GL_ERROR} "ImportError: No module named OpenGL.GLUT" ERROR_POS

content.raw: I added the  `CheckDRIDisplay.cmake` to `test/CmakeLists.txt` for now. I hope it'll just be temporary. I think it would be nice to use a virtual frame buffer such as Xvfb or Xdummy to run these kinds of tests instead of skipping them completely.
content.html: I added the CheckDRIDisplay.cmake to test/CmakeLists.txt for now. I hope it'll just be temporary. I think it would be nice to use a virtual frame buffer such as Xvfb or Xdummy to run these kinds of tests instead of skipping them completely.

content.raw:
I think that this actually allows us to get rid of the `initialized` variable, if we want to.

i.e. `if (initialized)` -> `if (nullptr != engine)`
content.html:
I think that this actually allows us to get rid of the initialized variable, if we want to.

i.e. if (initialized) -> if (nullptr != engine)
